meanings.definition: To take up and hold by either adsorption or absorption.
meanings.sent1: The sponge sorbed all the spilled water quickly.
meanings.sent2: The plant sorbed nutrients from the soil to grow.
meanings.sent3: The paper towel sorbed the juice like a thirsty desert.
meanings.sent4: Her mind sorbed every detail of the story like a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The black hole sorbed everything in its path, even light.

meanings.definition: To take up and hold by chemical or physical forces.
meanings.sent1: The fabric sorbed the dye, creating a vibrant color.
meanings.sent2: The activated charcoal sorbed the toxins in the water.
meanings.sent3: The magnet sorbed the metal pieces as if by magic.
meanings.sent4: His words sorbed her attention completely.
meanings.sent5: The tree roots sorbed nutrients from the soil like straws.
